title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video follows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups and emphasizes that route planning is made easy. It positions Copilot Groups as a tool for simplifying route-planning tasks.
bullets: Primary focus: Copilot Groups and route planning
Narrative element: Jo discovers the feature
Key message: route planning made easy
takeaways: If your operations involve field routing or logistics, Copilot Groups are presented as a tool worth exploring for simplifying route planning.
Decision-makers should assess whether Copilot Groups can streamline coordination for maintenance or site-visit routing workflows.
Consider evaluating Copilot Groups in a pilot to determine fit with existing routing and dispatch processes.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the podcast explains that AI is already embedded in modern audit work, helping teams with repetitive tasks, large‑scale data analysis and decision support. Hosts Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska outline practical AI tools (like Transaction Scoring and Clara AI), client benefits, shifts from sampling to full‑population analysis, and the skills, security and regulatory issues auditors must address.
bullets: AI enables analysis of full populations (AI Transaction Scoring Tool) rather than relying solely on sampling.
Clara AI (conversational assistant and specialized agents) supports documentation, disclosure analysis and auditor workflows.
KPMG Clara platform provides real‑time audit management and Clara for Clients improves client communication.
Technology shifts the auditor’s role, requiring new competencies and adaptation to innovation.
Implementation raises challenges around adoption, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI‑related risks.
takeaways: Full‑population analysis means audits can be more comprehensive—ensure systems can provide timely, audit‑ready data access.
Real‑time platforms like KPMG Clara create opportunities for faster reporting and closer client collaboration; consider integration and data exchange standards.
Data security and regulatory requirements are central when sharing operational and financial data with AI audit tools—prioritize encryption, access controls and compliance checks.
Prepare staff and vendors for changed workflows and new auditor interactions by investing in relevant AI and data‑analytics competencies.
Evaluate vendor platforms and client‑facing tools (e.g., Clara for Clients) for functionality, security and fit with your audit and operational processes.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator on Talos-II; the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield launch trailer emphasizes NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Game genre: 3D real-time strategy RPG; player role: Endministrator exploring Talos-II.
Trailer capture: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Official links provided for the game and NVIDIA DLSS 4 announcement.
Developer and NVIDIA social channels and hashtags included for follow-up.
takeaways: Retail launch uses DLSS 4 MFG — validate DLSS 4 compatibility in QA and compatibility testing pipelines.
Marketing and performance captures are leveraging high-end GPUs (RTX 5080 at 4K) — plan GPU resources for capture and benchmarking.
Wider adoption of DLSS 4/MFG can affect procurement for development and content-creation workstations.
Cloud gaming and streaming providers should assess instance/GPU configurations to support DLSS 4 and high-resolution workloads.
